title: Scientists Want to Build Moon Homes

content.en: Do you want to live on the moon? It's very different from here.
content.tw: 你想要住在月球嗎? 這跟在地球生活很不一樣喔。

content.en: Here, the air is safe to breathe. On the moon, there is lots of dust. Breathing moondust is very dangerous. It's very sharp! It can kill you!
content.tw: 地球的空氣很安全，但月球上有很多的灰塵。吸入這些灰塵很危險，可能會要了你的命。

content.en: Do you still want to live on the moon? Well, maybe you can! Some scientists in the USA think we can live there by 2040. That's 17 years from now!
content.tw: 這樣你還想住在月球上嗎? 美國科學家覺得17年後，也就是2040年我們就可以在月球生活。

content.en: These scientists say we can make moon homes from moondust. Moondust and water make moon cement! The moon cement goes into 3-D printers. Then these printers print moon homes!
content.tw: 科學家說我們可以用月亮的灰塵做月球住宅。月球的灰塵加水可以混和成月球水泥，再用3D列印機打造月球住宅。

content.en: This is very smart. We don't need to take heavy cement to the moon. That saves a lot of money. One kilogram of anything costs 32 million Taiwan dollars to take to the moon!
content.tw: 這樣我們就不需要把笨重的水泥送到月球，還可以省下很多錢。

content.en: Scientists say we can live on Mars next. It's a long way there. But we can go to the moon first and then go to Mars! In 17 years, we can live in moon homes made of moondust! Let's get ready to go!
content.tw: 科學家說我們接下來可以住在火星。雖然路途遙遠，但我們可以先到月球，然後再去火星！17年後，我們就可以住在由月塵製成的月球屋裡！準備好出發吧！

vocabulary.preface: 建造月球房屋可以就地取材，不必遠從地球運過去。

content.text:
1. live 居住
Would you like to live in a moon house? 你想住進月球屋裡面嗎?
You want to send me there? 你想把我送去?
I can't send you anywhere even if I want to.

2. dangerous 危險的
True. But living on the moon? 那是真的。不過住在月球上嗎?
No, too dangerous.

3. Mars 火星
I could be hit by meteors any time.我可能隨時會被流星打到。
But from there you can travel to Mars!

4. breathe 呼吸
Nothing on Mars attracts me. 火星沒有吸引我的東西。
I can't even breathe there.

content.en: How big is your school? Some schools are small. They are far from cities. They have two or three hundred students.
content.tw: 你的學校有多大呢? 有一些離城市遠的學校，有大概兩、三百位的學生。

content.en: And some schools are very small. They are on a mountain, in a forest, or on an island. They have twenty or thirty students.
content.tw: 還有一些在山上、森林或離島更小的學校，有二、三十位學生。

content.en: But there are smaller schools! Do you know about the school with two students? That's right! It has two students.
content.tw: 但你知道還有更小的學校嗎? 只有兩位學生。

content.en: Where is it? It's on Hujing Island in Penghu. Few families live on this small island.
content.tw: 這間學校在澎湖虎井嶼，住在島上的家庭沒剩多少。

content.en: The two students are in sixth grade. They will finish elementary school next year. What happens when there are no students? The school closes.
content.tw: 學校的兩位學生都是六年級生，明年就要畢業，到時學校就得關閉。

content.en: The principal is sad about this. He knows the five teachers work hard. He wants to get new students.
content.tw: 校長很難過，他知道學校的五位老師認真教學，他希望能有更多的新學生。

content.en: So the school will give free breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day of the school year to new students. It will also give them five plane tickets!
content.tw: 所以學校每年將會提供新生免費早餐、中餐、晚餐，也會提供五張返台機票。

content.en: Now there are no new students. But how about you? Do you want to go to school on a small island? Yes? How about the elementary school on Hujing Island?
content.tw: 現在沒有新學生。但你呢？你想去小島上的學校讀書嗎？想嗎？虎井嶼上的小學怎麼樣？

vocabulary.preface: 小小學校為了吸引學生，不但贈送三餐，還有機票。

content.text:
1. breakfast 早餐
This school offers students breakfast, lunch and dinner.
這個學校提供早餐，中飯和晚飯。
Every day? 每天嗎?
Every day. 每天。
That's so generous! 真慷慨!

2. finish 完成
I know. Think about how much time it can save you.
我知道，想想看這可以節省你多少時間。
But my youngest kid is about to finish school! 但是我最小的孩子就快畢業了。

3. how 如何
How could he grow so fast? 他怎麼長那麼快?
I thought he's still 10 years old. 我以為他還是十歲。
Yeah, kids grow much faster than you think.是啊，小孩遠比你想的長得快。

4. happen 發生
So what will happen next? 所以接下來會怎樣?
I'll be free. 我就自由了。
